question: Do astrocyte calcium waves promote the initiation and maintenance of seizures or seizure-like discharges? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: We found that a Ca2+ elevation in astrocytes correlates with both the initial development and the maintenance of a focal, seizure-like discharge.
content.source_2: In vivo recordings did not support a recurrent excitatory neuronâ€“astrocyte loop; selectively elevating astrocytic Ca2+ failed to ignite or sustain ictal discharges and instead reduced network synchrony.
content.source_3: Our data reveal that neurons engage astrocytes in a recurrent excitatory loop (possibly involving gliotransmission) that promotes seizure ignition and sustains the ictal discharge.
content.source_4: Elevations in astrocytic Ca2+ neither preceded seizure onset nor tracked ictal maintenance across trials; pharmacological blockade of intercellular glial Ca2+ waves did not alter seizure threshold or duration.
